replies.body: Read the first sentence then stopped
I'm guessing u understood the point or u didn't care either way welcome :)

Ok let's start off with the technical details right?

> [**Punishments generally follow a basic escalation path**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-)

>** First Offense:** 10 Game Chat Restriction
**Second Offense:** 25 Game Chat Restriction
**Third Offense: **Two Week Suspension
**Fourth Offense: **Permanent Suspension

Except in extreme cases like speech and death threats (or consistent gameplay abuse or cheating) you will receive them in order.

Basically, you're on your first warning here. You've had enough bad games recently you've been hit by tier 1. So where does your account standing go from here?

[With 3 months of good behaviour](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/f/mNBeEEkI/d/p7scKW1K?comment=00050000000000000000) your account will drop back into tier 0, so if you get punished again it'll only be a 10 game chat restriction instead of a 25, and sometime soon (more than likely within that 3 months) you will get hextech crafting rewards back.

Continue the behaviour that got you punished however and you will be hit by tier 2, then tier 3, then 4. The 3 months of good behaviour will only drop you one tier, so please be aware of that. If you make it to permanent suspension, you won't be getting your account back under any circumstance excepting that of a system error.

>However, it is possible to skip to a Two Week or Permanent suspension based on the severity of the behaviour in the game. Excessive negative behaviour can result in a Two-Week or Permanent suspension at any time without having a chat restriction on the account.

When they say excessive, they really do mean it, but be aware.
___
Ok so the specifics of your situation.

>at least show the whole fucking chat for the game i was in

The whole chat log is reviewed by the system, and if others in the game were reported their behaviour was evaluated as well. That said, the system is designed to encourage reform, not hate circles. What's important to you and your behaviour is your chat log and noone elses. You're meant to be reviewing **your **behaviour, and realising what **you ** said that was unacceptable, independent of any other factors.

> There was an AFK troll in my team...

It sucks. Yeah it really does. But retaliation is not an appropriate answer. Defending yourself, or grumbling about it is fine, not necessarily helpful, but perfectly ok. That changes the second you cross the line into toxicity. 

Everyone defines that line a little differently, determined by whether they report you or not, and if someone else was toxic first the line might be a little further away, but think of it this way: Would you report someone if they said what you did? That's a good place to start at least.

> i could just mute him but what kind of Beta does that.

Contrary to what you seem to think, being the bigger person and muting them makes you, funnily enough, the bigger person. More importantly as far as the restriction is concerned, it makes you the bigger person that your other teammates don't start cursing for a terrible experience and waiting for the chance to report you.

> Someone punches ur friend and u just gonna sit there and fucking watch.

Your situation is more like someone was yelling at you across the room and you yelled obscenities back and you both got kicked out of the _insert establishment here_ because this is a community that doesn't appreciate that kind of behaviour.

> Like honestly if ur gonna be so butthurt, just stay the fuck of the internet.

See my last point, take your own advice and take it "outside".

> Yea sure "Autism" and "Bronzie" were so hurtful.

Bringing disability into a conversation is no bueno, under _**any **_ circumstances. Bringing rank into it is almost always a pain point, and "Bronzie" is an insult whether they are in Bronze or not the way you're using it.

>  i know what i said showing me twice isn't gonna make me "Less toxic" I'ts just gonna piss me off by not letting me see what the others also write cause they sure as hell weren't clean

Ideally you'd be looking at what you said without the influence of what happened in the game itself, and realising that it wasn't ok, hence the restriction. It doesn't matter if they were clean or not, the system will judge them just as it did you, and if they were punishment worthy then it will punish them just as it did you.

About the Hextech craft thing, i really don't care about chest and all that cause i'm a 1 trick so its not like i haven't got 1 for my champ anyways does that include Lv 6 and 7 tokens??? Like Does What u say about the Hextech reward also include the tokens too?

Short answer: Yes

Mastery 6 and 7 tokens are earned and claimed through hextech crafting, so losing eligibility for hextech crafting will prevent you from earning and Mastery 6 or 7 tokens until you earn back hextech rewards.
And how long till i am eligible again??

> [Signs of reform. Once your puinshment has ended, you'll continue to be restricted from earning loot until you're recognized to have made significant progress in amending your past behavior. There isn't a specific timeframe for this--it all depends on your behavior.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207884233-Hextech-Crafting-Guide)

It's not a set time period, but for a 10 game restriction, if you show consistently good behaviour you should have it back in about a  week.
